casebody.data:
Henry Newman, respondent, v. Emil Greef, et al. appellants. Decided April 7, 1884. Appeal by defendant from judgment, entered upon a verdict of jury for plaintiff, and from order denying defendants’ motion for a new trial made upon the judge’s minutes. W. Z. Larned, for appellant; Stern & Myers, for respondent.

Before Sedgwick, Ch. J., Truax and O’Gorman, JJ.

Opinion Per Curiam. Judgment affirmed with costs, and order appealed from affirmed with $10 costs and disbursements to be taxed. Truax, J., dissented.
